item.description:
Let's try something different!  Join me to hear some Dusty Springfield, Lulu, and Petula Clark in "SHOUT! The Mod Musical" at the Rochester Opera House, http://www.rochesteroperahouse.com/ , on Friday, January 27 at 8 pm.  It's supposed to be funny and entertaining!!

Let's start off with dinner in Rochester before the show.  I thought it would be nice to try The Chef's Table as I've heard good things about it.  The Chef's Table is at 19 Hanson Street, near the ROH/City Hall building.

Tickets can be purchased in person or by telephone on Monday/Wednesday/Friday from 10 to 5 at 603-335-1992.  When you order your ticket mention that you want to sit at "Debbie's Trailblazers table" or my name, Debbie Champagne.  You could also order online at the ROH website, but then you would not be seated at our table.  Tickets are $30.00 per person.  It's general admission.  They'll be removing the rows of seats and setting up cocktail seating (round tables for up to 12) for this show! 

Try to be at the restaurant BY 6 pm so we can order early then relax and enjoy each other's company before heding over to the nearby Rochester Opera House.  The ROH doors open at 7 pm for light refreshments, but as we'll be eating dinner first, we will plan to leave the restaurant at 7:00 or so for the short walk to the Opera House at 31 Wakefield Street inside City Hall.  It's a beautifully restored venue that we've enjoyed before.  If you can't make it for dinner, please plan to meet us in the lobby of City Hall at 7:15 or at the Trailblazers' table after that time.  The ROH requests that we all be in our seats by 7:50, late seating is up to their discretion.

Here's a little bit about the show:

It's London in the Swinging Sixties Swing into 1960s London with the mod fashions, the dance crazes and the smashing music as the Rochester Opera House becomes a posh British night club replete with a live band, cocktail seating, cash bar and great food. Mix with five young women, beautiful birds, as they come of age during the dawn of liberation, when English and American women were redifining themselves. The timeless, unforgettable music of artists like Dusty Springfield, Petula Clark, LuLu and Shirley Bassey, reflecting the changes in attitude toward gender, is laced together with hilarious sound bites from the era. Shout! is directed by Anthony Ejarque and Kelli Connors with live band directed by Kathy Fink and choreography by Kelli Connors. *The orchestra seats are removed and the floor is flat with cocktail seating! *Cash Bar. 18+ *Light Supper, Desserts and Snacks by the Portable Pantry. *So that tables can be arranged to seat your party: please call the box office to reserve your tables. *Wheelchair/Handicap accessibility in balcony only.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at Restaurant by 6, ROH lobby by 7:15, or at our "Debbie's Trailblazers" Table inside

group.name: Trailblazers- A Seacoast Singles Meetup Group

item.name: "SHOUT! The Mod Musical" at the Rochester Opera House & Dinner at Chef's Table
